Fales Library and Special Collections
Gregory Thompson Journals
Thompson, Gregory
MSS.631
1.10 Linear Feet in 2 manuscript boxes and 1 half manuscript box
1978-1988 Gregory Thompson was an artist and graduate of the School of Visual Arts in New York City. The Gregory Thompson Journals (1978-1988) consists of 10 notebooks and sketchbooks, as well as printed copies of diary entries and photographs. Materials in the collection date from approximately 1978 to 1988 and document Thompson's life as an artist living with AIDS in Manhattan during the AIDS epidemic. The collection also contains several pornographic photographs, sketches, and postcards depicting men engaging in sexual acts. Thompson died in 1988 of AIDS related complications. Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.
Scope and Contents
The Gregory Thompson Journals (1978-1988) consists of 10 notebooks and sketchbooks, as well as printed copies of diary entries and photographs, belonging to artist Gregory Thompson. Material in the collection date from approximately 1978 to 1988 and document Thompson's life as an artist living with AIDS in Manhattan during the AIDS epidemic. The collection also contains several pornographic photographs, sketches, and postcards depicting men engaging in sexual acts.
Biographical Note
Gregory Thompson was an artist and graduate of the School of Visual Arts in New York City. Thompson died in 1988 of AIDS related complications.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Conditions Governing Use
Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Joseph Lovett are maintained by New York University. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from Fales Library and Special Collections. Please contact Fales Library and Special Collections, special.collections@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Joseph Lovett in May 2023. The accession number associated with this donation is 2023.042.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Gregory Thompson Journals; MSS 631; box number; folder number or item identifier; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University.
Processing Information
Materials were rehoused in acid-free boxes and folders in their original order. Materials were described on the collection-level and inventoried at the box-level.
Notebooks Sketchbooks. Photographs. Artists. Journals. AIDS (Disease)
